title: One Survives

intro.speaker: Tormod
intro.line: Listen and be amazed! BIG news afoot! The apostle is sending an inspection team to investigate the occupation army's abuses!

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Really?

intro.speaker: Tormod
intro.line: She sent me a message that preparations are finally complete. But wait...it gets better. She also issued an imperial edict to the occupation forces telling them to cease all military action immediately!

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Does that mean the fighting is over? That we've won?

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: Indeed. It's hard to believe it's over. It almost seems too easy.

intro.speaker: Tormod
intro.line: And best of all, Duke Persis is leading the inspection team! We'll be home free the moment they arrive. Our worries are over.

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: Duke Persis...Lord Sephiran? So Apostle Sanaki's dispatching one of the empire's greatest men to handle this.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: What kind of man is he?

intro.speaker: Tormod
intro.line: He is amazing...the best person ever! He's incredibly influential and high up, but he never stood on ceremony with us. Well, go on, you guys! Don't just stand there. You have to spread the news!

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: We have to spread the news? Aren't you going with us?

intro.speaker: Tormod
intro.line: Umm...nah. It's mostly your doing. We'll hold back...let you take the glory.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: It's Izuka, isn't it? You don't want to come because he'll be with the prince.

intro.speaker: Tormod
intro.line: Well, yeah, basically.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: All right...but wait here! We'll come right back once we've announced the good news.

intro.speaker: Begnion
intro.line: ...In light of which, Her Imperial Highness, Empress Sanaki, has conveyed to you this edict. Occupation forces are to hereby lay down all arms, convene in Daein Keep, and await the inspection team.

intro.speaker: Jarod
intro.line: Hmmm...

intro.speaker: Begnion
intro.line: Duke Numida maintains that your forces performed alleged abuses independently...in flagrant violation of his orders. The apostle, in her mercy, will hear your testimony. Do not abuse her magnanimous spirit...and lose your small advantage.

intro.speaker: Jarod
intro.line: Hah! What a magnificently ruthless maneuver. I didn't know Numida had it in him. Disowning the entire occupation army...and framing me for their actions. Brilliant.

intro.speaker: Alder
intro.line: So then...the game is over. Might we at least drag Duke Numida down with us?

intro.speaker: Jarod
intro.line: Not a chance. We are proof that Duke Numida--and therefore the entire senate--is corrupt. No doubt they'll work together to silence us. Besides, there's more tantalizing prey than those tottering relics. If I'm to fall, so too should the one who upended our plans and drove us to this dead end... That girl.

intro.speaker: Alder
intro.line: Oh... I like that. Our final mission.

intro.speaker: Jarod
intro.line: You create a diversion with the troops tonight, after dark. And I will seek our target...the girl's silver-maned head.

intro.speaker: Izuka
intro.line: A-hhrrmm! Silence! Prince Pelleas would now like to favor you with a word. You may begin, my prince.

intro.speaker: Daein
intro.line: Am I dreaming? Everything looks so delicious! What should I eat first...?

intro.speaker: Pelleas
intro.line: Everyone, you've done a fine job. Once the inspection team arrives, Daein will be free once again! In anticipation of our emancipation, I invite you to eat and drink to your hearts' content.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: ...Whew... Yune! What is it? You didn't need to slip away from the banquet, too.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Silly you! You're kind of a mysterious bird, you know that? How is it you can fly around even at night?

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Oh, Yune...for some reason...I feel so tired lately. ...But it won't be long... I'll go back home to Nevassa...and then...save Daein...

intro.speaker: Jarod
intro.line: So, you escaped the idiot's ball to be alone? How trusting of you, Silver-Haired Maiden... No--I'm sorry--"Priestess of Dawn." If you really can work miracles, you'd best work one up for yourself now.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Hm? What? Oh! Begnion soldiers!

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: General Jarod?! Why are you here?

intro.speaker: Jarod
intro.line: I'm doomed, thanks to you. But if I have to go down, I'm taking someone with me... The vice-general to the Daein Liberation Army, the revered "Priestess of Dawn."

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Even if you kill me, the kingdom of Daein will be reborn. As long as the prince survives, the people will fight.

intro.speaker: Jarod
intro.line: Hah! The prince! He's a sham, a travesty, a clod of mud no amount of polishing could shine. The real jewel--whose radiance attracts the people like moths to flame--is you, Priestess. And so I shall steal you and extinguish Daein's light of hope! Know despair, Priestess of Dawn!

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Ah!

intro.speaker: Jarod
intro.line: Guhahh!

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Who are you?

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: Be at ease, Maiden. I shall not let him harm you. I was once one of the Four Riders, serving the army of old Daein. If you recall the name of the Black Knight, you will withdraw from this place at once.

intro.speaker: Jarod
intro.line: Riiiight! That's precious. You're the legendary Black Knight? Maybe you haven't heard...he died in the war. But let's put your claim to the test, if only to indulge my own amusement.

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: Then have at me...and learn your folly.

intro.speaker: Jarod
intro.line: In due time. But before I bother, why don't you have a go-round with my restless minions? Douse the torches!

intro.speaker: Black Knight
intro.line: Maiden. I shall be your shield. Remain by my side.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: I will. I know I can trust you.

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: Sir Knight, how did you know I was in danger?

battle-talk.speaker: Black Knight
battle-talk.line: That is not important right now. Are you injured?

battle-talk.speaker: Black Knight
battle-talk.line: Maiden, stay by me. I will not let them harm you.

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: I know you won't. Thank you.

boss.speaker: Jarod
boss.line: I see you're pretty impressed with yourself!

boss.speaker: Black Knight
boss.line: Did you think the likes of you could be a worthy opponent for me? Know your place.

boss.speaker: Micaiah
boss.line: General Jarod! Your occupation army has caused untold suffering to the people of Daein... The time has come! You must atone for your deeds!

boss.speaker: Jarod
boss.line: As if I should care one whit about the wretched worms I trample!

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: Make your peace. This blow will be your end.

end.speaker: Jarod
end.line: Heh... How kind of you...

end.speaker: Alder
end.line: Gugrh...

end.speaker: Jarod
end.line: Alder?! You... Why are you here?

end.speaker: Alder
end.line: I'd rather fight beside my general than create a distraction with the other soldiers.

end.speaker: Jarod
end.line: You idiot! Who asked you to join me?

end.speaker: Alder
end.line: General Jarod... You are a terror to work under. Even so...I've always sensed a kindred spirit in you. I will follow you and fight for you...to the very gates of the abyss...

end.speaker: Jarod
end.line: He was a good soldier... What now? Why don't you kill me?

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: My sword is not made for killing those who will not raise their weapons.

end.speaker: Jarod
end.line: You've got to be kidding me!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Stop! Stop it, both of you! A man has died protecting you. Don't waste his sacrifice!

end.speaker: Jarod
end.line: This is not the end!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: No. It's not.

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: You would simply let him go?

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: He is not ours to judge. He belongs to the apostle now. I suppose he must bury his fallen friend and pray before facing her.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: You have my thanks for saving me.

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: There is no need for thanks.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Micaiah, are you safe?!

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: You! Micaiah, run!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Sothe! It's OK. This knight just saved my life!

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: What?! Micaiah, do you know who this is?

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Everybody knows who he is, Sothe! He is the Black Knight. One of the Four Riders under King Ashnard, and the strongest swordsman--

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Exactly! The scum that General Ike defeated in Nados Castle in Crimea, three years ago. So how can he be here now...alive?

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: You are correct, Sothe. Ike did defeat me in that battle, in a fashion. But as you can see, I managed to escape.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: What do you want?

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: For Daein to raise its banner as a kingdom once again. I came here to protect those who are necessary for that dream.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Sothe, General Jarod was here a moment ago. If the Black Knight hadn't stepped in, Jarod would have killed me.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: What?! But...I don't see his corpse here. And that means...he's still alive, isn't he?

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Yes. There was another soldier who sacrificed his life protecting Jarod. I presume Jarod's burying him now. Oh! Oh, no...

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: What is it?!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: I see a dark cloud... It's dimming the light of hope... By letting Jarod go, I may have allowed something terrible to happen...

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: You aren't sure?

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Sothe, I hadn't told you, but I haven't been feeling well lately. My mind feels...foggy. Things I could always see clearly are now dim and vague. I may have committed us to an irreversible fate.

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: I shall aid you. No matter what Jarod may plot, I will prevent it.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Micaiah and I don't want your help!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Sothe, stop that! In King Ashnard's War, you severed below General Ike, and you and the Black Knight were enemies. But now, you are comrades with the same goal--Daein's restoration. Listen to me. The Black Knight was Daein's strongest general. We need him.

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: And I am willing to serve.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Sir Knight... That you should come to us now, is surely the will of the goddess. I thank you for your aid just now, and ask you to lend us your strength a while longer.

end.speaker: Black Knight
end.line: May my sword serve you well, Maiden of Dawn.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: I don't like this...

narration: A figure from Daein's past appears unexpectedly in the night. A figure thought to have perished in the Mad King's War, the blood-stained right hand of the king himself, the mysterious Black Knight.

The Black Knight protects Micaiah against Jarod's cowardly surprise attack. However, Micaiah suspects that Jarod has one last move to make. Deprived of his chance to capture Micaiah, Jarod abandons all notions of retreat or negotiation. Instead, he makes plans for revenge. He murders an emissary from his homeland of Begnion and reclaims control of Daein Keep.

From within the keep, he launches a savage barrage of catapult fire, all but destroying the castle town. The momentary peace that arrived with the Begnion emissary shatters along with Nevassa's walls, and the people of the city see their kin and their capital crushed under a rain of stone. This treachery proves too much for them, and their grief explodes into rage.
Micaiah and company have pitched camp on a nearby hillside. When this merciless attack begins, its brutality leaves them lost for words.

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: Sothe. How unusual to see you alone.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Prince Pelleas. You here to see Micaiah?

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: Yes. At least, I intended to. But she is quite popular, isn’t she? She’s always so busy talking to everyone that I can never get near her.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: They’re your soldiers. Tell them to get out of the way.

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: No, I can’t do that. My job is to be the symbol of Daein’s liberation. But the Priestess of Dawn is no mere symbol. For her, the soldiers will gladly give their lives.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Prince Pelleas?

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: Oh, don’t worry, Sothe. I’m not jealous, if that’s what you’re thinking. It isn’t like that. Although I have to admit, I do envy her from time to time.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Hm.

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: I almost forgot. Here. These war funds are for you.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: But the war’s over. And, besides, this is a small fortune.

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: Yes, well, share it with the troops if you like. I may not be much a leader, but I truly appreciate the sacrifices everyone has made. They deserve something in return. Divide it up as you see fit. I trust your judgment.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Prince Pelleas, you should be the one to give the troops their reward.

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: Lady Micaiah.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Hello, Jill. What are you doing here?

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: I saw you walking over here as I was heading back to my tent. Is something wrong? You shouldn’t be leaving camp by yourself.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: I’m just exhausted from talking to so many people. But there’s no need for concern. I just need some time to myself.

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: Now that you mention it, you do look a little pale. Why not rest in your tent? It’d be much more comfortable.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: I don’t want Sothe and the others to know how tired I am. They worry too much.

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: Ah, I can see that. Sothe seems so detached from everything, unless it involves you... He gets so... worked up. He strikes me as a bit overprotective.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: We’ve always lived by ourselves, just the two of us. I don’t think he can help it.

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: Then I shall bring you some medicine, and I’ll make sure no one sees me. I’ll meet you at your tent.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Oh, no, that won’t be necessary! Do you see that tree? I’ll be resting over there. I should recover in no time.

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: But...

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: I’ll be safe. We’re still in camp. Besides, don’t you have an errand of your own to take care of? It must be really important to leave the feast so early in the evening.

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: Oh, no, not really. I just thought I’d write a letter to a friend. That’s all.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: To the man you told me about? The one you run a wyvern delivery service with?

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: Well... um, yes. You know everything, don’t you, Lady Micaiah?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: You’re going to tell him that the fighting is over, right?

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: Yes. More than anything, he despises trouble. He made a delivery to Begnion, and never returned. I’m sure it’s the war that has kept him away.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Really?

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: Well, indirectly, at least. To be honest, it’s probably more about his napping. Give him a few minutes of free time, and he’s sure to close his eyes and drift away. The war would certainly disrupt his sleep schedule.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: What an... interesting fellow. Well, you should write him and let him know it’s safe to return.

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: Are you sure you’re all right? You’re not pushing yourself too hard?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: I’m fine. Please, don’t worry about me.

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: All right. I’ll let you relax alone, then. Oh, but here... Please take this.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: What is it?

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: It’s a Pass scroll. It might come in handy. Please keep it, if you’d like.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Thank you, Jill. I will.

conversation.speaker: Jill
conversation.line: Good night, Lady Micaiah.
